analysis: The documents in this cluster primarily concern the establishment, modification, or termination of presidential advisory committees, commissions, boards, or working groups. These entities are created to address specific issues, conduct studies, provide recommendations, or coordinate policies across different government agencies. The topics covered range from defense management and national security to industrial competitiveness, world hunger, financial markets, and urban policy. The documents also cover delegation of authority, establishment of rules and procedures, and interagency coordination.
title: Presidential Advisory Groups: Formation, Function, and Policy
